snippet: The last time New York and Chicago baseball teams met with a trip to the World Series on the line was in 1908, a result of Merkle’s infamous running mistake.
abstract: Chicago Cubs fans, excited about team's chances of making it World Series, recall 1908 baseball season, which featured infamous base running mistake by New York Giants player Fred Merkle that costed his team National League pennant; game marks last time New York and Chicago baseball teams met with winner heading to World Series and last time Cubs won World Series.
lead_paragraph: The last time New York and Chicago baseball teams met with a trip to the World Series on the line was in 1908, a result of Merkle’s infamous running mistake.

headline.main: It’s Chicago vs. New York, With a Nod to Fred Merkle
headline.print_headline: Forget 1969. Cities’ Rivalry Is Built on a Gaffe for the Ages.
